title: The key changes being made to special educational needs - at a glance
partialText: The government has set out broad changes it will make to the SEND system in England in the coming years.

title: Andrew charged taxpayers for massage services when envoy, claim ex-civil servants
partialText: Whistleblower former civil servants claim there was too little scrutiny of Andrew's costs as UK trade envoy.

title: BBC sorry for airing racial slur shouted by guest with Tourette's at Baftas
partialText: Actors Michael B Jordan and Delroy Lindo were on stage at the time during the award ceremony in London.

title: Cartel henchmen unleash violence after top drug lord killed in Mexico
partialText: The death of the most-wanted Jalisco cartel chief sparks retaliatory violence in at least a dozen states in Mexico.

title: No 10 says 'nothing off the table' over new US tariffs as UK could be among worst hit
partialText: Downing Street says discussions are ongoing following US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 15% global tariffs.

title: 'Closest I've felt' - Hodgkinson on breaking longest-standing world record
partialText: Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson says she feels "closer than ever" to breaking the women's 800m outdoor record - the longest-standing world record in athletics.

title: Zelensky tells BBC Putin has started WW3 and must be stopped
partialText: Ukraine's president sat down with the BBC's Jeremy Bowen in Kyiv days before the four-year anniversary of the war.

title: Australia backs removing Andrew from royal line of succession
partialText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor remains eighth in line to the throne despite being stripped of his titles.

title: Porn company fined £1.35m by Ofcom over age check failings
partialText: Ofcom's £1.35m fine on 8579 LLC is the largest it has levied under the Online Safety Act so far.

title: Mescal and Abrams go official, William's 'I'm not calm' comment and other key moments
partialText: This year's Bafta Film Awards had it all... A-listers, a touch of royalty, Paddington Bear - and the sun even came out, for what felt like the first time all year.

title: The winners list in full
partialText: One Battle After Another won six awards, followed by I Swear, Sinners and Frankenstein, with three each.

title: Watch: How the winners accepted their awards
partialText: One Battle After Another took home best film and Hamnet also saw success in the outstanding British film category.

title: How cartel leader El Mencho became Mexico's most wanted man - and what his killing means
partialText: The BBC's Will Grant examines the power wielded by the Jalisco drug cartel chief, who died after a clash with security forces assisted by US intelligence.

title: 'I saw grown men cry': The 102-year-old kitman's story to be told in film
partialText: Charlie O'Leary was the Republic of Ireland kitman, but his influence extends to football across the island.

title: Steve Rosenberg: Four years into its full-scale war in Ukraine, Russia is feeling the effects
partialText: Steve Rosenberg reports on the economic consequences of Russia's war, and how people are coping.

title: Last surviving teacher of Aberfan disaster still remembers faces of the children who died
partialText: Mair Morgan says the disaster that killed 144 people remains etched into her memory.

title: Why has Alan Carr bought a castle and where is it?
partialText: The comedian has purchased a castle in the Scottish Borders which comes with 17 bedrooms and its own working railway.

title: I put my old tandem up for sale - it ended up with Kenya's national team
partialText: Dr Carrie Ruxton was surprised when a Kenyan cyclist got in touch asking if the bike could help her country's paracycling team.

title: 'Confront failure and fix it': Families speak ahead of Nottingham attacks inquiry
partialText: Hearings are under way at a public inquiry into attacks in Nottingham that killed three people.

title: Benfica's Prestianni gets provisional one-match ban after alleged racial abuse
partialText: Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni receives a provisional one-match Uefa suspension after Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr reported alleged racist abuse during last week's Champions League meeting.

title: Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says
partialText: The suspect was carrying a shotgun and fuel can when he was killed, officers say, while Trump was in Washington DC at the time.

title: Reform promises agency to ensure illegal migrant removals
partialText: The party's new home affairs spokesman Zia Yusuf says it would be a "burning" priority for a Reform UK government.

title: Teen guilty of belonging to banned neo-Nazi group
partialText: The boy, 16, is also convicted of the possession of terror documents and sharing terror publications.

title: Briton among 19 killed in Nepal bus crash
partialText: Nepalese police say the British national was a 24-year-old man.

title: Rob Jetten becomes Netherlands' youngest ever PM
partialText: The 38-year-old is sworn in as premier after clinching a narrow victory in October's election.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Gordon Brown turns detective over Andrew
partialText: Gordon Brown has reportedly demanded a police investigation into the use of RAF bases.

title: Trump's Tariffs... Trump attacks the Supreme Court over tariff ban
partialText: A breaking episode of Americast as POTUS takes on SCOTUS

title: Benfica's Prestianni gets provisional one-match ban after Vinicius incident
partialText: Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni receives a provisional one-match Uefa suspension after Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr reported alleged racist abuse during last week's Champions League meeting.

title: 'Closest I've felt' - Hodgkinson on breaking longest-standing world record
partialText: Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson says she feels "closer than ever" to breaking the women's 800m outdoor record - the longest-standing world record in athletics.

title: Fifa wants injured players to stay off for one minute
partialText: Players who receive treatment for an injury could be forced to stay off the field for one minute under proposals from Fifa.

title: Three countries, 25,000 miles - England's daunting summer itinerary
partialText: England will take to the skies for their summer fixtures against South Africa, Fiji and Argentina, posing difficult decisions for the team.

title: O'Sullivan signs up for World Seniors Championship
partialText: Ronnie O'Sullivan, 50, is set to make his debut in the World Seniors Snooker Championship at Sheffield's Crucible Theatre in May.

title: Why Leeds would be flying high without league-worst late-goal record
partialText: After conceding another late goal on Saturday, we look at the stats that show Leeds would be seventh in the Premier League if games ended after 85 minutes.
